task_info.description: Website fixes and WP Rocket configuration

task_description:
We have a potential new client who is looking for website fixes and enhancements. They have shared a spreadsheet outlining their requirements.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YqcyaAWTYPdbJk3OoJ-4KmWWxXTf6K6RBaIcay04Lcs/edit?tab=t.0

Please let me know if this is feasible and an estimate of how long it will take.

Thank you.
task_comments:
We will fully configure WP Rocket to meet the technical specifications:

Page Caching
Enable page caching for all public pages
Cache lifespan: Homepage: 4 hours, Internal pages: 8 hours
Automatic cache purge on content update
Separate cache for mobile users
Compatibility adjustments for logged-in users

File Optimization
Minification of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Combining CSS and JS where possible
Deferred and async loading of JavaScript
Delayed script execution to improve mobile performance
Preload, prefetch, and preconnect configuration

Browser Caching & GZIP
Configure .htaccess for: CSS/JS: 1 year, Fonts: 1 year, Images: 6 months
Enable GZIP compression
Enable ETag and static file versioning

Database & Object Caching Setup
Configure Redis Object Cache (if supported by server)
Object TTL: 2 hours
Optimize database tables
Enable query caching where applicable

Lazy Loading & Media Optimization
Native lazy loading for images
Image preloading for LCP elements
WebP compatibility check

CDN Image Loading (Optional Add-on)
If the client decides to use a CDN (Cloudflare / BunnyCDN / CloudFront):
CDN zone setup and SSL configuration
Integrate with WP Rocket CDN module or Offload Media
Sync existing images to CDN
Rewrite media URLs
Implement WebP with fallback
Configure caching TTL and hotlink protection
Implement adaptive and responsive images

Deliverables
Fully optimized caching system via WP Rocket
Improved TTFB and mobile performance
Technical documentation and admin instructions
Before and after performance reports from: Google PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, WebPageTest (if required)

Expected Performance Results
TTFB under 200 ms (depending on hosting quality)
Mobile score improvement from 64 to 85-95
Faster image loading (approximately 40-50% improvement with CDN)

Requirements
To proceed efficiently, we require the following details:
Website and server information
Details of any WordPress caching plugins currently in use
CDN preference (Cloudflare recommended for optimal performance)

Estimated Time and Hours
Option 1: WP Rocket Configuration and Caching Setup - 4 to 6 hours
Option 2: WP Rocket Configuration and Caching Setup with CDN Integration - 9 to 10 hours

Notes
The timeline may vary based on responses, confirmations, and feedback.
Any additional changes may impact the estimated hours.
The website already has good speed performance; our goal is to further enhance and fine-tune optimization for improved loading speed, stability, and overall user experience.

Thank you.
